results.title: Protective effect of lisinopril on hepatic ischemia/reperfusion injury in rats

results.title: Lisinopril inhibits endothelin-1 in the early period of hepatic reperfusion injury in a partial hepatectomy model.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ inhibits @GENE_EDN1 @GENE_24323 @@@endothelin-1@@@ in the early period of @<m>DISEASE_Reperfusion_Injury</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015427 @@@hepatic reperfusion injury@@@ in a partial hepatectomy model.

results.title: Effect of angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors on ischaemia-reperfusion-induced renal injury in rats.
results.text_hl: Based on these results it may be concluded that @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ markedly protected against @<m>DISEASE_Reperfusion_Injury</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015427 @@@ischaemia-reperfusion@@@-induced @DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@renal injury@@@ and any additional renoprotective effect of @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@ may be ascribed to its @CHEMICAL_Free_Radicals @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005609 @@@free radical@@@ scavenging properties.

citations.NLM: Krishan P, Sharma A, Singh M. Effect of angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors on ischaemia-reperfusion-induced renal injury in rats. Pharmacol Res. 1998 Jan;37(1):23-9. PMID: 9503476

results.title: Effects of lisinopril and captopril on calcium in rat heart.
results.text_hl: This @CHEMICAL_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002118 @@@calcium@@@ lowering effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lis@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@Cap@@@ may be important in protecting the @<m>DISEASE_Reperfusion_Injury</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015427 @@@ischemia/reperfusion damage of myocardium@@@.

results.title: Comparative cardioprotective effects and mechanisms of vitamin E and lisinopril against ischemic reperfusion induced cardiac toxicity.
results.text_hl: Subsequent to @<m>DISEASE_Reperfusion_Injury</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015427 @@@I-R injury@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lsp@@@ demonstrated modest antioxidant effects, superior recovery in left ventricular function as compared to the control IR group.

citations.NLM: Mohanty IR, Arya DS, Dinda A, Gupta SK. Comparative cardioprotective effects and mechanisms of vitamin E and lisinopril against ischemic reperfusion induced cardiac toxicity. Environ Toxicol Pharmacol. 2013 Mar;35(2):207-17. PMID: 23328120

results.title: Study of the protective effect of ischemic and pharmacological preconditioning on hepatic ischemic reperfusion injury induced in rats
results.text_hl: Yirmibesoglu35 recorded the ability of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ to improve the serum level of liver transaminases after @<m>DISEASE_Reperfusion_Injury</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015427 @@@hepatic IR injury@@@ induced in @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ through decreased @GENE_EDN1 @GENE_24323 @@@endothelin-1@@@ levels.
